Vestorius,⁰ our common friend, writes to me that you say you are profoundly grateful to me. That you should speak out so frankly is very gratifying to me, and I have not the slightest objection to your doing so in the presence of others, and particularly of course in the presence of our friend Siro.¹’ For it is my desire that anything I do should be com- mended most by those who have most discernment.
